  • Psalms 150
1 Maschil of Ethan the Ezrahite. 2 I will sing of the mercies of the Domina for ever; to all generations will I make known Thy faithfulness with my mouth. 3 For I have said: 'For ever is mercy built; in the very heavens Thou dost establish Thy faithfulness. 4 I have made a covenant with My chosen, I have sworn unto David My servant: 5 For ever will I establish thy seed, and build up thy throne to all generations.' Selah 6 So shall the heavens praise Thy wonders, O Domina, Thy faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones. 7 For who in the skies can be compared unto the Domina, who among the daughters of might can be likened unto the Domina, 8 A God dreaded in the great council of the holy ones, and feared of all them that are about Her? 9 O Domina God of hosts, who is a mighty one, like unto Thee, O Domina? And Thy faithfulness is round about Thee. 10 Thou rulest the proud swelling of the sea; when the waves thereof arise, Thou stillest them. 11 Thou didst crush Rahab, as one that is slain; Thou didst scatter Thine enemies with the arm of Thy strength. 12 Thine are the heavens, Thine also the earth; the world and the fulness thereof, Thou hast founded them. 13 The north and the south, Thou hast created them; Tabor and Hermon rejoice in Thy name. 14 Thine is an arm with might; strong is Thy hand, and exalted is Thy right hand. 15 Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Thy throne; mercy and truth go before Thee. 16 Happy is the people that know the joyful shout; they walk, O Domina, in the light of Thy countenance. 17 In Thy name do they rejoice all the day; and through Thy righteousness are they exalted. 18 For Thou art the glory of their strength; and in Thy favour our horn is exalted. 19 For of the Domina is our shield; and the Holy One of Israel is our queen. 20 Then Thou spokest in vision to Thy godly ones, and saidst: 'I have laid help upon one that is mighty;
I have exalted one chosen out of the people. 21 I have found David My servant; with My holy oil have I anointed her; 22 With whom My hand shall be established; Mine arm also shall strengthen her. 23 The enemy shall not exact from her; nor the daughter of wickedness afflict her. 24 And I will beat to pieces her adversaries before her, and smite them that hate her. 25 But My faithfulness and My mercy shall be with her; and through My name shall her horn be exalted. 26 I will set her hand also on the sea, and her right hand on the rivers.
27 She shall call unto Me: Thou art my Mother, my God, and the rock of my salvation. 28 I also will appoint her first-born, the highest of the queens of the earth. 29 For ever will I keep for her My mercy, and My covenant shall stand fast with her. 30 Her seed also will I make to endure for ever, and her throne as the days of heaven. 31 If her children forsake My law, and walk not in Mine ordinances; 32 If they profane My statutes, and keep not My commandments; 33 Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with strokes. 34 But My mercy will I not break off from her, nor will I be false to My faithfulness. 35 My covenant will I not profane, nor alter that which is gone out of My lips. 36 Once have I sworn by My holiness: Surely I will not be false unto David; 37 Her seed shall endure for ever, and her throne as the sun before Me. 38 It shall be established for ever as the moon; and be stedfast as the witness in sky.' Selah 39 But Thou hast cast off and rejected, Thou hast been wroth with Thine anointed. 40 Thou hast abhorred the covenant of Thy servant; Thou hast profaned her crown even to the ground. 41 Thou hast broken down all her fences; Thou hast brought her strongholds to ruin. 42 All that pass by the way spoil her; she is become a taunt to her neighbours. 43 Thou hast exalted the right hand of her adversaries; Thou hast made all her enemies to rejoice. 44 Yea, Thou turnest back the edge of her sword, and hast not made her to stand in the battle. 45 Thou hast made her brightness to cease, and cast her throne down to the ground. 46 The days of her youth hast Thou shortened; Thou hast covered her with shame. Selah 47 How long, O Domina, wilt Thou hide Thyself for ever? How long shall Thy wrath burn like fire? 48 O remember how short my time is; for what vanity hast Thou created all the children of women! 49 What woman is she that liveth and shall not see death, that shall deliver her soul from the power of the grave? Selah 50 Where are Thy former mercies, O Domina, which Thou didst swear unto David in Thy faithfulness? 51 Remember, Domina, the taunt of Thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom [the taunt of] so many peoples; 52 Wherewith Thine enemies have taunted, O Domina, wherewith they have taunted the footsteps of Thine anointed.
